text:
Disappearing into neglected woods, Past a dirt path toward a tangle of trees, I scraped and I struggled Through spiraling thorns embedded In bark, in shade, in flesh. For some troubled time, I shuffled and turned, I twisted and ducked, contortedly Forging the wooded trail.

With sweat on my lips and dust on my tongue, I wiped my brow, as fingers unfurled. Over thinning twigs and fallen trees, With a final ascent, I reached for plains, Open in air, searching the sky Its simple blue drifting through My ever-wandering eye.
